not being picky here. just honest. the quality of the picture is severely degraded and extremely dark. it almost looks like youre watching it on an old VHS tape. some scenes its so dark and blurry that everything just fades into a mess of black. i dunno if the academy just sent out a degraded copy of the movie for screening or if maybe the ripper just did a mediocre job, but its pretty bad. 

still, its good enough to get us by till the real versions leak, but yea. just giving you guys a heads up.

not gonna mention audio cuz its already been mentioned multiple times here. just felt an honest post about the picture quality needed to be posted
thank you thank you thank you!! You're awesome!

Pretty good video, though the watermark, that appears from time to time is a bit annoying. Great Audio, but it's not in sync. I started with +0.4 seconds, but turned it up to +1 second halfway trough the movie. Still Great quality, and small file size :D

Cams don't have watermarks. they are not released in theaters but are for the film academy to preview, or for movie reviewers like Siskel & Ebert or Leonard Martin, 
A cam cannot be a screener. what movie in IMAX, or in any theater have you gone to see, pay 15+ dollars to see, then all kinds of warnings pop up every 20 mins? The answer is none. The watermarks are there to prevent it from being released in a theater, enough said.
I agree with @lenhoy's comments (in VLC, 'k' on the key board will increase the speed and 'J' will decrease it). V=7, A=8. Ta.
